definitions.a: A blueprint for creating objects that defines the properties (attributes) and behaviors (methods) of those objects.
definitions.b: A unit of data and behavior created from a class, representing an instance of that class.
definitions.c: A special type of function called to create an object.
definitions.d: A procedure that defines the behavior of objects created from a class.

definitions.a: The act of defining a method in a child class that has the same signature as the method in the parent class, replacing the parent's version.
definitions.b: Function overriding is a type of polymorphism in which we redefine the member function of a class which it inherited from its base class.
definitions.c: Data abstraction refers to providing only essential information about the data to the outside world, ignoring unnecessary details or implementation.
definitions.d: Encapsulation in C++ is defined as the wrapping up of data and information in a single unit.
